# Top 12 Best Goal Tracking Apps & Goal Setting Apps 2024

Date:Tuesday, January 9, 2024

Author:

  * Sandra Petrova

SHARE:

  * __
  * __
  * __
  * __

**Quick Summary:**

Goal-tracking and setting apps are more than just digital assistants; they're
your personal roadmap to success, empowering you to set, track, and achieve
your aspirations with precision and motivation. We delve deep into each app,
highlighting features that cater to various ambitions, whether personal
growth, fitness, career advancement, or financial planning.

Goals are a cornerstone of a healthy and productive life. And there is no
better way to track your personal and business goals than with the help of the
best goal setting apps?

This post will discuss some of the best goal tracking apps available,
including Habitica, Way of Life, Coach.me, and Strides, that can help make you
track your goals and progress. Whether you want to eat healthier and get in
shape or launch a new project, setting and tracking your goals is critical.

So, let's find the perfect app that will guide you to reach your goals this
year!



## Best Goal Tracker App & Goal Setting App Comparison Chart (Top 10 Highest
Rated)

Before we dive into each tool in greater detail, let’s briefly look at the ten
best goal setting software, how they compare in terms of pricing, and what
each one is best for.

## What Are the Best Goal Tracking Apps? Here’s Our Top 12 List:

Goal setting doesn’t have to be challenging.

Every good goal tracker app lets you track goals, sends you daily reminders,
and lets you unlock rewards for a motivation boost. And, many of these apps
come with a free plan!

Let’s look at the top 12 goal-setting apps:  


### 1\. Way of Life (Best Goal Tracking App Overall)

####  **Why We Chose It:**

If you’re looking for the best way to track goals, Way of Life is a habit-
tracking app you should look into. It allows you to set and track personal
goals related to habits and routines. You can create custom habit categories
and track progress over time through daily check-ins and visual charts.

The app also includes features such as reminders and the ability to set
streaks and rewards to help you stay motivated and on track with your goals.
The habit tracker app is available for multiple platforms, such as iOS,
Android, and Mac.

####  **Pros:**

  * Simple and intuitive interface

  * Rich with features

  * Different themes to choose from 

  * Note-taking functionality

  * Customizable habit categories

  * Interactive walk-through

  * Offers charts and graphs of your progress

####  **Cons:**

  * The free plan lets you track up to three goals

  * No option to track OKRs

####  **Pricing:**

  * Free plan for up to three goals

  * $9.99 one-time purchase 

 **Visit site**  
Go to Way of Life’s official website  


### 2\. Habitica (Best Free Goal Tracking App With Gamification)

####  **Why We Chose It:**

Habitica is a free goal tracking software that gamifies personal productivity
by turning daily tasks and habits into a role-playing game. What makes it one
of the best free goal tracking apps is the gamification element that lets you
create your own avatar, earn points and rewards for completing tasks, and join
guilds to collaborate with other players.

This free goal tracker app includes features such as a to-do list, calendar,
and habit tracking, as well as the ability to set up custom challenges and
compete with friends. Habitica is available on multiple platforms, including
the web, iOS, and Android.

####  **Pros:**

  * Free to use

  * Great for people who love games

  * Task completion rewards

  * Active community 

####  **Cons:**

  * Steep learning curve 

  * No desktop apps, only mobile apps

####  **Pricing:**

  * Free 

 **Visit site**  
Go to Habitica’s official website  


### 3\. Coach.me (Goal Planning App if You Want Access to Personal Coaches)

####  **Why We Chose It:**

Coach.me is a goal-tracking and personal development app that helps users set
and achieve their goals through the use of coaches, mentors, and a supportive
community.

It landed on our list as the best goal planner app as it offers a variety of
coaching programs and personalized plans, as well as features such as daily
tracking, progress tracking, and the ability to connect with other users for
support and accountability.

Coach.me is available on multiple platforms, including the web, iOS, and
Android.

####  **Pros:**

  * Comes with a free plan

  * Simple and intuitive to use

  * You can hire a personal coach 

  * Community support

  * A good deal of unique features 

####  **Cons:**

  * Can be buggy at times

  * Personal coaching is pricey

####  **Pricing:**

  * Free 

  * Personal coaching starts at $25/week 

 **Visit site **  
Go to Coach.me’s official website  


### 4\. aTracker (Great App for Daily Goals)

####  **Why We Chose It:**

aTracker is a habit and daily goal tracker app that helps you establish and
maintain good habits and achieve your goals by breaking them into smaller,
manageable tasks.

You can use this daily goals app to set reminders, track progress, and view
detailed statistics and charts to analyze your performance.

What's more, you'll be able to create custom categories for different types of
tasks and set goals for yourself, including daily, weekly and monthly goals.

####  **Pros:**

  * Free option

  * Comes with an affordable one-time cost

  * Time-tracking functionality 

  * Fully customizable user interface

  * Categorize tasks with tags

  * Suitable for tracking personal, work, and school-related goals

####  **Cons:**

  * The Android app is not as refined as the iOS

####  **Pricing:**

  * Free, but comes with restrictions

  * Premium version, $2.99 /month

  * Pro version, $4.99 one-time cost

 **Visit site**  
Go to aTracker’s official website  


### 5\. ClickUp (Top Business Goal Tracker App)

####  **Why We Chose It:**

ClickUp is a project management and team collaboration app that comes with
solid goal tracking tools for achieving your business goals. You can set and
track goals, assign them to team members, and monitor progress in real-time.

As you can learn in our detailed ClickUp review, the app allows you to create
custom goal templates, set deadlines, and track progress using metrics such as
completion percentage and time spent.

There’s a good deal of team collaboration and communication functionality,
making it easy for team members to communicate progress, give feedback, and
work together toward goal completion.

We also voted ClickUp as one of the best project management software as it’s
highly versatile and customizable and comes with affordable pricing.

####  **Pros:**

  * Generous free version with unlimited users

  * Easy-to-use interface

  * Integrates with third-party software

  * Fully customizable

  * Comes with a time-tracking functionality 

####  **Cons:**

  * Not suitable for users who want to track small personal goals

####  **Pricing:**

  * Free, supports unlimited users

  * Unlimited, $5/user/month, billed annually 

  * Business, $12/user/month, billed annually 

  * Business Plus, $19/user/month, billed annually 

  * Enterprise, custom quote

 **Visit site **  
Go to ClickUp’s official website  


### 6\. GoalsOnTrack (Top Personal Progress App for SMART Goals)

####  **Why We Chose It:**

GoalsOnTrack is a personal goal setting software and personal goal tracking
app that helps you establish and maintain good and new habits and achieve your
SMART goals by breaking them into smaller, manageable subgoals.

This personal goals app comes with a good selection of features and
functionality, including reminders, progress tracking, and detailed statistics
and charts to analyze your performance. The best thing is that you can set up
daily, weekly and monthly goals, review past performance and adjust your goals
as you go.

A neat journal feature allows you to reflect on your progress and make notes
on what worked and what didn't.

####  **Pros:**

  * Set SMART goals

  * Supports both personal and business goals

  * Build detailed and organized action plans

  * Set recurring tasks

  * Automatically tracks your habit strength and daily execution

  * Comes with great features, such as a built-in journal and vision board tool

####  **Cons:**

  * No free plan 

####  **Pricing:**

  * $67.99/year

 **Visit site **  
Go to GoalsOnTrack’s official website  


### 7\. Strides (Good Life Goals App for Personal Use)

####  **Why We Chose It:**

Strides is a fantastic app for setting and tracking life goals and it comes
with a generous free plan. The app makes it easy to track progress, set
reminders, and view detailed statistics and charts. You'll be able to create
custom goal templates, set deadlines, and track progress using metrics such as
completion percentage, time spent, and more.

You can even set up and track multiple goals at once and set up recurring
goals. If you need a little bit of motivation to stick to your goals, there's
a feature that lets you reward yourself once you've achieved a goal.

####  **Pros:**

  * Simple and intuitive

  * Track good and bad habits

  * Daily, weekly, and monthly goals

  * Apple Health integration for iPhone, syncs to Mac

  * Progress reports

  * Green/red pace line system to stay on track

####  **Cons:**

  * Lacks an Android app

  * It’s geared toward individual use

####  **Pricing:**

  * Free plan

  * Monthly plan for $4.99/month 

  * Lifetime plan for a one-time fee of $79.99 

 **Visit site**  
Go to Strides’ official website  


### 8\. Habit — Daily Tracker (Best Free Goal Setting App)

####  **Why We Chose It:**

Habit — Daily Tracker is a free goal setting software available for iOS
devices. The app allows you to set up and track daily habits and routines.

You can create custom habit templates, set reminders, and track progress using
metrics such as completion percentage and streak length. If you want to
analyze your performance, there are detailed statistics and charts.

You can track unlimited habits, customize the app with the color you love, and
add motivational quotes to your habits. The interface is clean and graphic,
and there are no distracting bells and whistles.

####  **Pros:**

  * Modern interface with color customization 

  * Completely free to use

  * Track unlimited habits 

  * Dark mode

  * Has more than 900,000 users 

  * Ad-free experience 

####  **Cons:**

  * Available only on iOS devices 

####  **Pricing:**

  * Free 

 **Visit site **  
Go to Habit’s official website  


### 9\. Apple Notes (Best Goal Setting App for iPhone Users)

####  **Why We Chose It:**

Apple Notes is a built-in note-taking app for iPhone devices. It’s one of the
best apps for setting goals if you’re looking for a simpler and free option.

One way to use Apple Notes for goal tracking and habit building is by creating
a note for each goal or habit you want to track. Within the note, you can
include information such as the goal or habit you want to achieve, the steps
you need to take to achieve it, and a schedule for tracking your progress.

You can set reminders and checklists and even add images or audio recordings
to help you stay on track. Additionally, Apple Notes has a feature that allows
you to share your notes with others, which can be useful if you're working on
a goal or habit with a friend or accountability partner.

####  **Pros:**

  * Free to use

  * Ad-free

  * Simple and intuitive

  * Great for personal use

  * Add attachments - photos, maps, web links, documents, and more

  * Secure sensitive or personal data in a locked note

  * Use your finger or Apple Pencil on an iPad to sketch your note

####  **Cons:**

  * Available only to Apple users

####  **Pricing:**

  * Free 

 **Visit site **  
Go to Apple Notes’ official website  


### 10\. GoalsWon (Great Android Goal Tracker App)

####  **Why We Chose It:**

GoalsWon is a unique goal setting and tracking app that replaces personal/peer
accountability with human coaching. The app integrates an expert human coach
that will offer you direct and personalized accountability.

Your personal coach will review your goals and give you personalized tactics
and friendly support. Overall, this is a fantastic app for building healthy
habits, whether you strive to eat healthier, achieve career growth, or
overcome procrastination.

####  **Pros:**

  * Personalized support 

  * Available on Android and iOS

  * 7 days a week service

  * Free onboarding video call

  * Dedicated GoalsWon coach

####  **Cons:**

  * Expensive monthly plans 

####  **Pricing:**

  * Monthly, $3.00/day or $90/month

  * Quarterly, $2.67/day or $80/month

  * Yearly Special, $2.00/day or $60/month

 **Visit site **  
Go to GoalsWon’s official website  


### 11\. Toodledo (Best Goal Tracker and Habit List App)

####  **Why We Chose It:**

Toodledo is a to-do list and goal tracking app that helps you monitor your
self-improvement, stay motivated and achieve your goals. You can easily set
goals and break them into smaller, manageable tasks. You can keep track of the
number of completed tasks that are related to each goal and measure your
progress.

The software lets you set both short-term and long-term goals, reminders, and
custom folders and tags to organize tasks.

There's a neat feature called Goal Chains that is a visual way of looking at
the number of tasks you have completed for each goal. The chain gets longer
each time you complete a task that contributes to your set goal. If you miss a
day, the chain will get broken.

There are plenty similar apps for GTD followers, so make sure to check out our
Toodledo alternatives article.

####  **Pros:**

  * Works with different productivity styles, including GTD method

  * Works with Apple Watch

  * Assign tasks to goals

  * Intuitive interface

  * Free plan option

  * Offers a good deal of productivity and collaboration features 

####  **Cons:**

  * The interface might look outdated

####  **Pricing:**

  * Free plan

  * Standard, $2.99/month, billed annually 

  * Plus, $4.99/month, billed annually 

  * Business, custom quote

 **Visit site **  
Go to Toodledo’s official website  


### 12\. Trello (Good Progress Tracking App)

####  **Why We Chose It:**

Trello is a task management and team collaboration app that can also be used
as a goal progress tracker. It allows users to create boards representing
different projects, goals, or focus areas.

Within each board, users can create lists, which can mean different stages or
milestones of a goal, and cards, which can represent individual tasks or
actions needed to achieve the goal. You can set due dates and add comments and
attachments to cards.

Additionally, Trello has a feature that allows you to share boards with
others, which can be useful if you're working on a goal or habit with a friend
or accountability partner. Overall, this can be one of the best apps to track
progress, but only if you’re okay working with Kanban boards.

You can learn more about this popular tool in our comprehensive Trello review.

####  **Pros:**

  * Several plans to choose from

  * Free version

  * Great for personal use

  * Low learning curve

  * Good selection of features 

####  **Cons:**

  * Might not be a good choice if you don’t like tracking goals in Kanban boards

####  **Pricing:**

  * Free

  * Standard, $5/user/month, billed annually 

  * Premium, $10/user/month, billed annually 

  * Enterprise, custom quote

 **Visit site**  
Go to Trello’s official website



## Which is the Best Goal App for Me? Key Takeaways

The 12 goal-setting and goal-tracking apps we discussed in this post are all
great options for those wondering how to keep track of goals and make sure you
achieve them.

While we voted The Way of Life app as the best goal app overall, it's
important to remember that the best app for you will depend on your specific
needs and preferences.

Habitica, for example, is a fantastic option if you want to achieve your goals
through gamification, while Strides can be a solid pick for setting and
tracking life goals. Apple Notes is a great go-to app for macOS/iOS users as
it comes built-in into their devices and is free to use. And if you need
software that will help you set and track business goals, ClickUp should be on
the top of your list.

When choosing a goal tracking app, it's important to consider your goals and
the features that will best help you achieve them. Take a look at the app's
interface, the type of goals it can track, and the resources it provides for
motivation and progress tracking.

Remember, the most important thing is to find an app that you’ll enjoy using
and that will help you stay motivated in reaching your goals. With the right
app, you'll be well on your way to achieving your goals in 2024 and beyond!

# Quitzilla Review 2024: App Features, Pricing, Pros & Cons

Last Updated:Wednesday, January 10, 2024

Author:

  * Monika Dimitrovska

SHARE:

  * __
  * __
  * __
  * __

Ever wished for a free app that could help you kick those stubborn habits to
the curb? Look no further – Quitzilla might just be the solution you’ve been
searching for.

In this Quitzilla review, we’ll explore how this app can be your partner in
breaking bad habits and making positive changes, so let’s dive right in.

### Table of Contents

  1. Quitzilla Review 2024: Is Quitzilla Any Good?
  2. Quitzilla Pricing Plans
    1. How Much Does Quitzilla Cost for Nonprofits?

    2. 2\. Customize Your Journey
    3. 3\. Celebrate Your Wins
    4. 4\. Motivation Tab
    5. 5\. Stay Accountable
    6. 6\. Reasons to Quit
    7. 7\. Powerful Stats
    8. 8\. Community Connection
    9. 9\. Upgrade for More
  6. Quitzilla Pros and Cons
    1. Quitzilla Advantages
    2. Quitzilla Disadvantages
  7. Quitzilla Complaints & Praise (Quitzilla Reviews From Real Customers)
    1. Review of Quitzilla Support
  8. Is Quitzilla Worth it? Key Takeaways
    1. Our Final Quitzilla Rating



## Quitzilla Review 2024: Is Quitzilla Any Good?

As you will learn in this comprehensive Quitzilla review, this isn’t your
typical habit tracking app. It’s your secret weapon against bad habits. With a
few taps, you track multiple habits, score rewards, and stay motivated like a
champ. Imagine quitting your habit and getting paid for it!

  *  **Stats that impress:** **** Check how much time and money you’ve saved. It’s like a success report card.

  *  **Cash in on rewards:** **** Quitzilla turns your savings into treats. Cash for quitting? Yes, please!

  *  **Personal motivation:** Add your reasons to quit and keep the fire burning. Plus, cool quotes to start your day.

  *  **Your rules:** **** Customize Quitzilla to fit your style. It’s your journey, your way.

  *  **Easy and awesome:** **** No hassle, just progress. Quitzilla keeps you on track with a smile.

  *  **More than quitting smoking:** Beat any bad habit, from food to caffeine to smoking. Quitzilla’s got your back.

The bottom line: Quitzilla is one of the best habit trackers on the market.
And it can be your ally in crushing habits. Stats, rewards, and your drive – a
winning combo to rock a new you!



## Quitzilla Pricing Plans

First of all, how much does Quitzilla cost? First, let's review Quitzilla
prices:

### How Much Does Quitzilla Cost for Nonprofits?

We looked into it, and right now, Quitzilla doesn’t have special prices for
nonprofits. But don’t lose hope! You can bookmark our article and check back
later. They might change things in the future, so stay tuned for updates!

You can also check Quitzilla’s official website for updates or contact
customer support for the most accurate and latest pricing information.

### Are There Any Quitzilla Coupon Codes or Promo Discount Vouchers?

We went on a hunt, but at the moment, Quitzilla isn’t offering any special
coupon codes or discount vouchers. While that might not be the news you were
aiming for, here’s a bright idea: you can bookmark our article and keep it
handy.

That way, you won’t miss out if Quitzilla decides to drop some deals in the
future. We’re keeping watch for you – stay tuned for updates!



## Quitzilla Free vs Premium: What’s the Difference?

Curious about the differences between Quitzilla’s free and paid versions?
Let’s break it down for you.

 **Free Version**

In the free version of Quitzilla, you’ll still get access to some pretty cool
features. You can track your habits, set goals, and receive motivational
quotes to keep you inspired on your journey to conquer bad habits.

It’s a great starting point for those wanting to dip their toes into habit
tracking without financial commitment.

However, the free version is limited to tracking two addictions, provides two
rewards, and lacks coping tools for fighting cravings.  


 **Paid Version**

The paid version has some extra goodies to level up your habit-busting game.
You’ll have the power to track multiple habits simultaneously, giving you a
more comprehensive view of your progress.

Plus, you can enjoy in-depth statistics that dive into your habit-breaking
journey, helping you understand your successes and areas for improvement.

Another perk of the paid version is the ability to customize your experience.
You can tailor Quitzilla to match your unique needs and preferences, making it
feel like your personal habit-fighting sidekick.

So, in a nutshell, while the free version of Quitzilla offers a taste of
habit-tracking magic, the paid version unleashes a whole array of features
that can take your journey to the next level. It’s all about finding the right
fit for your habit-breaking adventure!  


 **Community and Support**

In the paid version, you also gain access to a vibrant community of fellow
habit-breakers on a similar path.

This camaraderie can be incredibly motivating and provide you with a space to
share your successes and challenges and get encouragement from others who
understand your journey.  


 **Rewards and Motivation Boosts**

While both versions offer motivational quotes, the paid version takes it up a
notch.

You’ll have the chance to receive daily motivational reminders and challenges
that can give you that extra push you need to stay committed and focused on
your goals.  


 **Ad-Free Experience**

A bonus in the paid version is the absence of ads. Say goodbye to distractions
and interruptions – you can fully immerse yourself in your habit-breaking
journey without pesky pop-ups.  


 **Future Updates**

Investing in the paid version of Quitzilla unlocks the current set of features
and opens the door to potential future enhancements. As the app evolves and
new tools come into play, you’ll be among the first to experience them.  


 **Ultimately, the choice between the free and paid versions of Quitzilla
depends on how deeply you want to dive into your habit-breaking journey.**

The paid version offers a more comprehensive and tailored experience, while
the free version gives you a taste of what’s possible.

Whatever path you choose, Quitzilla will support you every step toward
conquering your bad habits and embracing positive change.



## Quitzilla Overview: What is Quitzilla & What is Quitzilla Used for?

Want to wave goodbye to bad habits? That’s where Quitzilla comes in! Quitzilla
is a simple app designed to make breaking habits a breeze.

Whether smoking, snacking, or something else, Quitzilla is here to help you

 **Here’s the fun part.** **** Quitzilla shows how much money you’ve saved and

 **The free version is pretty cool – you can track two habits.** But if you’re

 **Quitzilla doesn’t just help you quit; it rewards you too!** As you kick

 **Need some pep?** **Quitzilla’s got your back with daily motivational
messages.** Plus, you can jot down your thoughts and feelings in the diary
section, keeping you focused and motivated.

 **You know why you want to quit – health, money, a better you.** Add those
reasons in Quitzilla to remind yourself why you’re on this journey.

 **Overall, Quitzilla tracks your progress like a pro.** **** From the day you
started to the longest streak–it’s all there. And if you need extra oomph, it
even shares a motivational quote daily.

So, if you’re ready to kick those bad habits to the curb, download Quitzilla.
It’s your ally, your motivator, and your partner in becoming the best version
of you.

Goodbye, bad habits – hello, new you!

## Quitzilla Pros and Cons

Here’s a summary of the main advantages and disadvantages of Quitzilla:

### Quitzilla Advantages

  *  **Comprehensive Habit Tracking:** You can use Quitzilla on any device (Android or Apple) to simultaneously monitor your progress in overcoming multiple habits.

  *  **Motivational Support:** The app provides daily motivational messages and quotes to keep you inspired and focused on your journey to conquer bad habits.

  *  **Customization:** With Quitzilla, you can tailor your experience to match your preferences and needs, creating a personalized habit-breaking strategy.

  *  **Financial Gains:** The app calculates the money saved from quitting habits, turning it into a rewarding motivation to keep you on track.

  *  **Detailed Statistics:** Quitzilla offers insightful statistics about your progress, including days of abstinence, money saved, and more, helping you visualize your achievements.  


### Quitzilla Disadvantages

  *  **Limited Free Version:** The free version only allows you to track two habits. You’ll need to upgrade to the premium version to monitor more habits.

  *  **Lack of Coping Tools:** **** While Quitzilla’s free version offers tracking and motivation, it doesn’t provide specific coping tools to help you deal with cravings or challenges during your habit-breaking journey.

  *  **No Community Base:** Unlike other apps, Quitzilla’s free version lacks a community feature where users can connect, share experiences, and support each other.

  *  **Focused on Habit Tracking:** While Quitzilla excels at habit tracking, it may not provide as comprehensive support for other aspects of habit-breaking, such as developing strategies to avoid triggers.

  *  **Premium Subscription Cost:** **** The premium version comes at $2.99 monthly or $19.99 annually, which might be a consideration for users looking for free alternatives.

Overall, Quitzilla has both good and not-so-good reviews. Some folks find it

Since everyone’s experience differs, it’s smart to think about the good and

Just remember, Quitzilla wants you to succeed and do well in your journey to

## Is Quitzilla Worth it? Key Takeaways

Is Quitzilla worth it? Well, we honestly think it’s a great app for fighting
and conquering bad habits. Here’s why:

Quitzilla has a toolkit for breaking bad habits. In other words, it’s designed
to make your journey smoother and more motivating. From keeping tabs on your
habits to sending you daily doses of inspiration, this app has your back.

 **Imagine this:** **you’re tracking your progress effortlessly.** Quitzilla’s
user-friendly design ensures you don’t get lost in many features. It’s like
having a supportive friend guiding you along the way.

Those daily messages and quotes? They’re more than words; they’re your
personal cheerleaders, keeping you focused and excited.

 **And let’s talk about money** **** – Quitzilla is a great sobriety counter
because it doesn’t just help you quit; it shows you the cash didn’t spend.
That’s a tangible reward right there.

But, like anything, Quitzilla isn’t perfect, particularly the free version,
because it lets you track only two habits.

 **If you’re looking for more, the premium version has a price tag.** And
while the free Quitzilla brings motivation, some users have wished for extra
tools to tackle cravings and challenges head-on.

 **Another thing to note is the absence of a community connection in the free
version of this software.** **** If you’re seeking camaraderie and shared
experiences, this might be something to keep in mind if you’re unsure about
the premium version.

 **Remember, there’s a wide range of Quitzilla alternatives you can explore.**
**** They could help you find the perfect fit for your journey.

 **So, is Quitzila the right choice for you?** It depends on your particular
issue and needs. We suggest you weigh the pros and cons against your goals
before deciding.

We would give Quitzilla a 4.8 out of 5.
